results.title: I Don't kiss = J'embrasse pas
results.creator_credit: Bac Films (France), Cine Cinq, Gruppo Bruno, President Films, Salome, Maurice Bernart, Jacques-Eric Strauss, Jean Labadie and Andre Techine
results.brief_description: Manuel Blanc is Pierre, a young provincial adolescent who leaves his village to settle in Paris and become an actor. However, the big city proves difficult and expensive and when Pierre loses his job as a hospital orderly he soon finds himself working as a street prostitute. As his dreams disappear and his soul becomes hardened, it is only through his love for the enigmatic Ingrid (Emmanuelle Beart), who also works the streets, that Pierre can hold on to any aspirations for beauty and love. But Ingrid belongs to her pimp and Pierre’s desire soon leads to an inevitable tragic conclusion. Utilising the conventions of melodrama - including the cliched story of the “whore with the heart of gold” - Techine builds a compelling and gritty story of underclass life on the streets. Shifting from almost documentary style examination of the lives of the hustlers, junkies and criminals in the Paris underworld, to highly expressionistic colours and mise-en-scene for the fragile love affair between Pierre and Ingrid, “I Don’t Kiss” becomes a rhapsodic and moving account of the damages inflicted by both poverty and fate. In French with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bac Films (France), Cine Cinq, Gruppo Bruno, President Films, Salome, Maurice Bernart, Jacques-Eric Strauss, Jean Labadie and Andre Techine

results.title: I don't have to work that big
results.creator_credit: Michael McKennirey, John Smith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “West”.
Joe Fafard knows cows - the way they tuck in their forelegs to lie down and ruminate, the way a calf romps in the barnyard. He also knows people - all his friends and neighbors of the farming community of Pense, Saskatchewan. And he sculpts them all, in clay, in eloquent little miniatures. Joe’s work has been exhibited throughout western Canada as well as in Paris and New York. Here you see what he does.
results.title_for_label: I don’t have to work that big

results.title: I don't care what the Bible says
results.material_description: Digital screen recording of @theyoungturks' TikTok account
results.brief_description: On November 5, 2018, Ana Kasparian delivered an impassioned response to American conservatives justifying their denial of women’s reproductive freedoms based on their Christian faith. On May 4 2022, when leaked documents foreshadowed the overturning of Roe v Wade – which enshrines the right to abortion in the US Constitution – the viral clip resurfaced, gaining over 101k retweets, 8,613 quote tweets and over 321k likes on just one Twitter account, demonstrating how viral content can resurface and resonate again years after its original publication. Attacks on women’s body autonomy, sadly, go back far further than 2018.
results.title_for_label: I don’t care what the Bible says
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

On November 5, 2018, Ana Kasparian delivered an impassioned response to American conservatives justifying their denial of women’s reproductive freedoms based on their Christian faith. On May 4 2022, when leaked documents foreshadowed the overturning of Roe v Wade – which enshrines the right to abortion in the US Constitution – the viral clip resurfaced, gaining over 101k retweets, 8,613 quote tweets and over 321k likes on just one Twitter account, demonstrating how viral content can resurface and resonate again years after its original publication.
description_for_label: On November 5, 2018, Ana Kasparian delivered an impassioned response to American conservatives justifying their denial of women’s reproductive freedoms based on their Christian faith. On May 4 2022, when leaked documents foreshadowed the overturning of Roe v Wade – which enshrines the right to abortion in the US Constitution – the viral clip reemerged, gaining over 101k retweets, 8,613 quote tweets and over 321k likes on just one Twitter account, demonstrating how viral content can resurface and resonate again years after its original publication.

results.title: I didn't know you could tie
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
A child is assisted by the teacher to clarify her feelings about another child sho is engaged in an independent activity. The child’s inappropriate criticism is mildly reprimanded.

results.title: I Cover the Waterfront
results.brief_description: A reporter uses a girl’s friendship to expose her father’s smuggling activities. “I Cover the Waterfront” is a tough and daring melodrama about organised crime and the brave men who try to expose it. Stars Claudette Colbert. Rated: G

results.title: I confess
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: A compelling thriller based on the privacy of the Catholic confessional. A young priest, played by Montgomery Clift, hears the confession of a murderer. Later, the priest himself is accused of the murder, owing to his friendship with a woman who was being blackmailed by the victim. Anne Baxter plays the woman, Karl Malden the police inspector and Brian Aherne the Police Prosecutor. Adapted from the play by Paul Anthelme.
